intro: Rhyncospermum jasminoides, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
